intro: Androsace jacquemontii, commonly known as the Jacquemont's rock moss, is a low-growing alpine plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, often hairy leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
